page.title: 04Chickney's fertile fields
page.content: Chickney land is predominately arable with a few small areas given over to grazing. 3 farms keep beef cattle & 3 keep sheep. One farm rears turkeys for the meat trade, and another rears and releases game birds for shooting. The largest farm consists of 730 acres of arable land and was once 3 farms. At one farm 83 acres of grass have been sown and at another a small experimental crop of borage has been grown for vegetable oil and found to be successful; but the main crops gown are; wheat, barley, peas, beans, oil seed rape and potatoes. Artichokes are also grown for seed and as game bird cover. The farm buildings are generally well maintained, both for animal housing & storage.Pinewood Farm at Hamperden End has 5 grain silos and a workshop for repairing & maintaining farm machinery.Fertilizers are used.
